metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1619 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Multiple integer overflows in the (1) sycc422_to_rgb and (2) sycc444_to_rgbfunctions in fxcodec/codec/fx_codec_jpx_opj.cpp in PDFium, as used inGoogle Chrome before 48.0.2564.82, allow remote attackers to cause a denialof service (out-of-bounds read) or possibly have unspecified other impactvia a crafted PDF document.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1619` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1108
chromium-browser-l10n - 48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1108
chromium-chromedriver - 48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1108
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1108
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1108
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1108').
